column2: A higher minimum wage may be challenging for small businesses to afford and could lead to closures.
column3: Increasing the minimum wage will contribute to a reduction in income inequality and provide a basic standard of living for workers.
column4: Raising the minimum wage might accelerate the adoption of robotics and automation, potentially reducing job opportunities for unskilled or low-skilled workers.
column5: The minimum wage should be at least $15 and perhaps even higher to ensure a livable wage.
column6: A guaranteed minimum income might be a better approach to solving the systemic problem of income inequality.
